acceptedAnswer.text: CryptoPunks are a collection of 10,000 unique, 24x24 pixel art characters stored on the Ethereum blockchain, known for their rarity and distinct attributes.
CryptoPunks were created by Larva Labs, founded by software developers Matt Hall and John Watkinson.
CryptoPunks were initially distributed for free to anyone with an Ethereum wallet, fostering community engagement and accessibility.
Each CryptoPunk is algorithmically generated with unique attributes, and their ownership is verifiable on the Ethereum blockchain.

mainEntity.name: How have CryptoPunks impacted the NFT and crypto art space?

acceptedAnswer.text: CryptoPunks pioneered digital ownership concepts, influencing numerous NFT projects, and have become status symbols and a benchmark for digital art collections.

mainEntity.name: Where can I buy and trade CryptoPunks?

acceptedAnswer.text: CryptoPunks can be bought and sold on the Larva Labs Marketplace or on NFT platforms like OpenSea, using Ethereum.

mainEntity.name: What are some notable CryptoPunks sales?

acceptedAnswer.text: Notable sales include Punk #7804 and Punk #3100, both sold for 4200 ETH, and Punk #6965, sold for 10000 ETH.
Challenges include environmental concerns of blockchain transactions, market speculation, high entry costs, and issues with counterfeit listings on unofficial platforms.
